instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi everyone.

I have this plaque, liquid drop. Coffee.

The machine has 20V and consumption of 500ma.

I have <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
I have CPU voltages

I am missing PPVCCEDRAM_S0_CPU.

This voltage comes out of <CHIP>U7710</CHIP>, the activation PVCCEDRAMS0_EN_FILT_BUF
I'm missing, it comes from <CHIP>U7712</CHIP>.

<CHIP>U7712</CHIP> would like to know how this circuit works?

I understand through the PDF that it is activated by PVCCEDRAMS0_EN_R, it comes from <RESISTOR>R7758</RESISTOR> and it comes out of <CHIP>U7711</CHIP>.

<CHIP>U7711</CHIP> has <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, has <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD_R</SIGNAL>, but does not have <SIGNAL>PM_OPC_ZVM_L</SIGNAL>.

How should I interpret this problem?

I already restored the system, it gave me error 9.

Error 9, disconnect coils from the CPU and restore without problem. I understand that I have the problem in DDR or CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Not sure when this voltage should appear.
Check it on good working board.

It doesn't even appear on power on sequence.
Probably comes on later, depending of the CPU requirments.

What is the CPU core voltage (L7210) after 10-15s?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
when removing <CHIP>U7711</CHIP> the DDR voltage appears 1V.

Check another board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a and that voltage "signal" <SIGNAL>CPU_ZVM_L</SIGNAL> does not appear at any time.

Change <CHIP>U7711</CHIP> without positive results.

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with the same problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"that voltage "signal" <SIGNAL>CPU_ZVM_L</SIGNAL> does not appear at any time"
Not really true!
The voltage doesn't appear, but the signal yes.
Keep in mind, the ending "_L" means signal active low; <SIGNAL>CPU_ZVM_L</SIGNAL> is active with 0V.
If working board gives same level, then your problem is not there.

"What is the CPU core voltage (L7210) after 10-15s?"
???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I understand.

The voltage is 0.81 V at all times.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
The board doesn't boot then.
CPU core voltage should drop until 0.5-0.6V once booted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Heating up is not sign of boot.
CPU doesn't run in fact.
When CPU starts to work, you should note dynamic changes on its core voltage, according with its activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: machine <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had almost the same problem, I solved it with apple configuration 2. Restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 89154, member: 682"]
The board doesn't boot then.
CPU core voltage should drop until 0.5-0.6V once booted.
[/QUOTE]

So can you say the CPU is bad?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
May be CPU, problem, or T2 issue.
Even RAM problem is possible.

Did you try both DFU revive and restore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
yes of course, I restored but I had to disconnect the power of the cpu.

Because connected it gave me error 9
